attributes.action: Allow everyone working (self employed or employed) to claim travel expenses.
attributes.background: Anyone employed and paying tax shoud be able to claim any expenses incurred against any tax payable including travel expenses.
attributes.additional_details: Self employed people and business owners are able to claim expenses against any tax they may owe. It is unfair that the lower paid can not claim travel expenses when travel to and from work can be a large expense for them.

attributes.action: Remove the indirect sex discrimination from the new junior doctors contract.
attributes.background: Deem the technically lawful but blatant sex discrimination in the equality impact assessment done on the new contract for junior doctors in England unworthy.  Require the government to address the adverse impact of the nodal pay model on those working part-time under the new contract.
attributes.additional_details:
see 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/512696/jd-eia.pdf


"80. Insofar as the nodal pay model may disadvantage women working part-time (as compared with the hypothetical position under the existing contract) we consider 
25 that this is consistent with the principle of pay based on level of responsibility that 
underpins the new contract. Any indirect adverse effect which may occur is a proportionate means of achieving a legitimate aim." 

Note: The careful use of the term "indirect" to avoid falling foul of technical illegality, the wording falls foul of the spirit of the legislation but not the form.

attributes.action: Primary Care and Walk-in Centres open for 24 hours to tackle nhs waiting times
attributes.background: If Primary Care centres and Walk-in centres worked in a similar way to A&E departments this would cut the waiting times for appointments, help more people in need, take the strain off A&E departments and potentially create more jobs for GPs and nurses nationwide.

attributes.action: Stop Special Advisers for family members of Government Ministers and MP's
attributes.background: Special advisers should be be carefully scrutinised by the Parliamentary, expense standards  IPSA and should not be afforded to family members
attributes.additional_details: Recently the PM's wife was afforded the luxury of a fashion guru at the expense of the tax payer to the tune of £53,000

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to have a license to own an axe.
attributes.background: Today a police officer was attacked by someone with an axe.  Why are there not rules for people to own such an offensive weapon.  They are more deadly than firearms, they are silent and can be weilded indiscriminately.

attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: Reduce our foreign aid budget to that of the average of the 50 richest countries
attributes.background: We contribute more than any other nation other than the US. Who even they pay less than we pay taking in %GDP and per head of population.

attributes.action: make it illegal for fast food outlets to sell chicken on the bone
attributes.background: I live near several fast food outlets, people keep throwing their chicken bones on the street. I try my best but my dog keeps finding and eating them. He being sick and it had blood in and having a number 2 with blood in most recently. I'm worried this will end up killing him.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to gift Uganda a new Radiotherapy machine.
attributes.background: Uganda's only radiotherapy machine is broken beyond repair. Mulago Hospital, in the capital city of  Kampala, receives around 44,000 new referrals each year from neighbouring countries. Around 75% of these patients require this form of treatment. Their machine was second hand in the first instance.

attributes.action: The NHS to provide meals for staff, including staff at Queen's Medical Centre.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to provide meals for the staff at queens medical centre including agency staff that work at qmc. The staff work hard everyday and do not get a option whether they would like a meal, I'm writing this petition to ask you to get the nhs to provide meals for staff at the qmc.
attributes.additional_details: At the present moment if the staff at the queens medical centre eat the hospital food they get fired instantly, At fast food places such as McDonald's, burger king ect the staff get free meals, meanwhile the staff at queens medical centre save people lives everyday and they don't get the option. I would like the nhs to provide ethier free meals for the hospital staff or charge £1.00 per meal as they deserve it.

attributes.action: Support equal access to education for children in Africa.
attributes.background: Reports suggest that 70 million children get no education across the world and those living in north-eastern Africa are least likely to go to school. By raising awareness on the issue on a national scale we can help those children who are disadvantaged by supporting their journey through education.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/education/2010/sep/20/70m-get-no-education

An education would lead to a good career, build character and construct the foundations for a strong nation, which is further suggested by humanitarian Nelson Mandela; “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” If you teach a child how to read and write, it will allow them to be empowered with knowledge which will be crucial to give them a better future and the impacts to be sustained.

attributes.action: Stop armed forces recruiting in schools and lift joining age from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Stop the armed forces from recruiting in schools and change the joining age from 16 to 18

attributes.action: Drug test all politicians.
attributes.background: Following the Psychoactive substances bill of 2015, we respectfully ask that all Members of the houses of parliament both elected and unelected practice what they preach. We therefore call for compulsory drug testing of all members, and their removal from office should they fail.

attributes.action: Bring more awareness and raise more money towards Dementia Researching
attributes.background: I believe that not enough people are aware of how badly Dementia is becoming. 1 in 3 people over 65 will die with dementia. 850, 000 were diagnosed with dementia in 2015. Researchers are still unaware of the proper causes and require more money to extend research and medical help, so help raise it.
attributes.additional_details: Visit: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/statistics and https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/site/scripts/documents_info.php?documentID=535&pageNumber=2 for more information.

attributes.action: Allowing voluntary donations for NHS treatment, which are free at point of use.
attributes.background: I'm proud of our NHS and I would like to ensure we maintain a free at point of use NHS for future generations. Allowing voluntary contributions would help to secure vital NHS services. No one would be obliged or pressured to make these contributions, they would be on a strictly voluntary basis only.

attributes.action: Force news outlets to place more prominent apologies in publications.
attributes.background: Many publications make errors with what they print. Mistakes are fine, but apologies to those affected are often hidden or obscured from the publication's readers. This should be changed as many readers will never see the apology which causes unfair complications for those implicated by the mistake
attributes.additional_details:
Publications such as The Sun and The Mirror hide their corrections in a separate part of their website. See the Imgur link below:

http://imgur.com/a/uD6Bd

But plenty of other publications do the same thing. Apologies should be prominently placed on the homepage of every publication. This will reduce the number of errors publications make as their mistakes will be more easily noticed and scrutinized much more closely.

attributes.action: Redirect funds from accommodation of increasing road traffic to its reduction
attributes.background: Road traffic in the UK, similarly to many other countries around the world, is drastically increasing and causing irreparable global damage. We need to redirect funding of roadworks which seek to accommodate the increase, to funding of mass infrastructure allowing people cheap and efficient travel.
attributes.additional_details:
Electric bullet trains currently operational in parts of Asia are cheap, fast, eco-friendly and efficient. In the UK, infrastructure is an embarrassment which costs our pockets and the environment dearly. 

With investment in mass infrastructure development, we no longer allow the urgent concerns over CO2 emissions to be in the hands of time-restricted car consumers and money-hungry suppliers and, instead, raise this issue to the level of a national emergency.

attributes.action: Cameron to openly support the Kurdish people and sanction Turkish goverment.
attributes.background: The Turkish Goverment continues to attack the Kurdish people and course servier Human Rights abuse. We the undersigned feel that the UK goverment should applie sanctions on the Turkish Goverment untill these attacks stop.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Equal rights for ex-Students who took out a Student Loan before 2006.
attributes.background: If you took out a Student Loan before 2006 and don't earn enough to pay it back, it stays with you with amassing interest until your 65th Birthday. If you took your loan out after 2006 it's written off after 25 years or when you're about 46 years old. This is unfair and ageist, equal rights now!!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.slc.co.uk/services/loan-repayment/loan-cancellation.aspx

attributes.action: Use the sugar tax to heavily subsidise or make fitness activities free in the UK
attributes.background: The goverment keeps reminding us about obesity & how we should become more active well wouldnt it be better if the sugar tax was used to heavily subsidise sometimes expensive Gym, fitness activities and so give people incentives to become more active and in turn this could take pressure off the NHS

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid, transparent and accountable to the general public
attributes.background:
Gift Aid accounts for over £4 billion a year in government subsidy to
registered charities in the United Kingdom. This payment is neither
transparent nor able to be scruitinised by the general public.
attributes.additional_details: A recent FOI (Freedom of Information) request to the Treasury regarding Gift Aid was not possible, even by going through official channels (including through my local Member of Parliament). This petition is to open up the Gift Aid Mechanism to greater transparency, ensuring the destination(s) and amount(s) of this effective Government subsidy, is made readily available to the general public, enabling greater scrutiny of these funds and the organisations which receive this funding.

attributes.action: Confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving.
attributes.background: Give the police the power to confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving. (Not hands free). This will be more of a deterrent than any fines, cautions or points.

attributes.action: Spend more money on United Learning to save our children's education.
attributes.background: United Learning are struggling to keep good qualified teachers such as a member of the KBA Geography department because they can't afford to out pay other schools so children's education may suffer if amazing teachers such as he who is mentioned above are lost to schools without a proper curriculum.
attributes.additional_details: We think the government should pay United Learning more funds to preserve the next generation's education. This means that more children will be drawn to technology to try and replace the awful replacement teachers and therefore damaging their chances of a good education and furthermore a good life.

attributes.action: Allow Pensioners free dental treament
attributes.background: In the UK dental treatment is costly even on the NHS. Bad teeth are a significant cause of ill health. The NHS should look carefully at the damage charges do to pensioners health and others on reduced incomes.

attributes.action: Provide textbook grants for all students in key stage 4 and above.
attributes.background: For many students the high cost of basic curriculum textbooks means they cannot afford to access vital information needed to achieve their full potential. A single a-level physics textbook costs £40 -which acts as a massive discriminatory burden on less wealthy students and families.
attributes.additional_details: As a student I have realised the burden of these costs; a single textbook is rarely the only material needed and additional workbooks and revision guides add to the mounting costs. The continually changing curriculum means most second hand textbooks are no longer fit for purpose forcing students to buy new. I believe the education gap between the wealthy and less so can be attributed to costs such as these, and providing a grant would help each young adult achieve their full capabilities.

attributes.action: Stop the cost of theory tests especially when people fail on one thing
attributes.background: My  Grandaughter has spent £180 and has failed on one thing this is without the cost of driving lessons, people are complaining but nobody seems to be doing anything.

attributes.action: Intervene in Crimea and return it to the Ukraine Government
attributes.background:
Russia has annexed Crimea and have claimed it since 2014. Two years later and no action has been taken. 

2,423 killed, 6,820 wounded, 378 missing and 2,768 people captured as a result of Russian Military Intervention. 

Economic sanctions are not enough. Action is needed.

attributes.action: Create Stricter Laws On Laser Attacks On Aircraft.
attributes.background: Laser attacks on aircraft have been on the rise in the UK and other countries globally. These severe attacks can disorientate pilots along with dazzling, distracting and even incapacitate them. The lasers involved are have been made very affordable and available increasing laser attacks as a result.

attributes.action: Create more facilities for those with mental health issues
attributes.background: Those with mental illness are often forced to take up hospital beds miles away from where they live, this can be disstressing in a time when they need the most support.
attributes.additional_details: Recreational facilities are created almost everyday, these are not a necessity!! Health is more important yet money is so often wasted! Nobody wants to be alone at such desperate times, but sometimes the distance of theses hospitals forces it to be more difficult; some of these sufferers have to spend nights in jail cells because these facilities are so limited.

attributes.action: Agree with European governments to radical plan to prevent drowning of refugees
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government and Parliament to work with other countries to adopt a radical plan to stop the drowning of Syrian refugees. People were horrified by the picture of the drowned boy on the beach but the drownings are still happening. We must have a plan which starts by ending tragedies.
attributes.additional_details:
Our radical plan: 
1) Naval rescue of refugees from Turkish beaches. 
2) Registration of rescued refugees and issuing of Temporary Refugee (TR) status identity cards. 
3) Temporary distribution of TRs to European countries. 
This will require: Suspension of current European legislation on refugees, management by UNHCR and recognition that refugees are being offered a temporary sanctuary NOT a permanent home. We believe that most TRs will want to return once peace is established in their country.

attributes.action: Prevent coffee from being sold to under 16 year olds
attributes.background:
A coffee shop served my 11 year old coffee without any adult being present. Apparently this is a done thing
Energy drinks have an age limit so therefore I feel something so high in caffeine should have the same restrictions.
Serving coffee to people so young without parents should not be allowed

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Make legal, individual to be in possession and smoke small quantity of cannabis
attributes.background: Cannabis is an illegal drug throughout the UK, although there may be scientific evidence to prove that it may be harmful but isn't it an individual's right to make that decision whether is be harmful to themselves or not. It should be legal for small quantity but not enough for distribution
attributes.additional_details: It provides medical benefits that some prescription drugs cannot

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Urge India to allow UNHRC intervention in Kashmir
attributes.background: On 17/08/16, the UNHRC stated that it 'could only assume the worst' following the failure of the Indian authorities to grant its office access to Kashmir. Recently, thousands of civilians have been injured by armed forces during continuing protests across the region. Death toll now exceeds 60.
attributes.additional_details: Refusal to allow a UNHRC visit comes at a time when the Indian state stands accused of using disproportionate force to crush protests. To date, military-occupied Kashmir has seen over 70000 killings, 8000+ enforced disappearances & countless cases of torture & sexual violence. The Indian state has given impunity to its armed forces so as to protect them from prosecution for international crimes, including war crimes. The state stands in violation of its own laws as well as international laws.

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: A government review into the feasibility of driverless trains within the UK
attributes.background: We request a government led industry review, working with all train operators/ management and unions into the feasibility of driverless trains in the UK. The current approach where millions of the population are constrained by the availability of train drivers (sickness or strike) is not acceptable
attributes.additional_details:
Driverless technology is being adopted across the car industry (e.g. Google, Nissan and Tesla). This technology on complex, multi vehicle transport routes. 
https://www.cbinsights.com/blog/autonomous-driverless-vehicles-corporations-list/

attributes.action: Restrict the speed of cyclists on mixed pedestrian/cyclist paths to 4 mph.
attributes.background: It is becoming very common for local authorities to improve provision for cyclists, at the expense of pedestrians, by making footpaths multi use. By the simple expedient of painting a bicycle on the footpath pedestrians lose the exclusive use of the footpath.
attributes.additional_details:
The figures for death and serious injury to pedestrians involved in accidents with cyclists is very low. But there is a perception of danger especially from inconsiderate riders.
If cyclists were restricted, to 4 mph as are class 2 mobility scooters, this would reduce the perceived threat from cyclists. This would create a compromise in mixing pedestrians with cyclists. This accepts the inevitable use by cyclists of the footpath and protects pedestrians as vulnerable road users.
